bibl.title: The Identity of Philinna in the Philinna Papyrus (PGM2 XX.15; SH 900.15).
bibl.note: P. Amh. II, 11 + P. Berol. Inv. 7504 = P.G.M. II, 20 = Suppl. Hell. 900 (= Pack2 1871), 15. If it is the case that the motive behind the ascription of the spells in the Philinna papyrus was to attach them to famous names, then Thessalian Philinna will have been the Philinna who was the mother of Philip Arridaios.
DICKIE Matthew W., The Identity of Philinna in the Philinna Papyrus (PGM2 XX.15; SH 900.15).
